lines.text: It has been man's constant labor to live in peace with his next door neighbor. And on the newcomer falls the chore of getting along with the man next door.

[to Donald, who just moved in]
You must be the new neighbor. I'll be right over, pal.
[Donald puts out the welcome mat at his door and Pete steps on]

[wildly shaking Donald's hand]
Glad to meet ya, neighbor!
[Donald hears the doorbell ring and he begrudgingly answers it]
[He sees Pete and his dog Muncey at the door. Pete is holding a bowl of some soup-like liquid]
[Donald gags and spits out the liquid and looks shocked]

[walking away with Muncey]
The trouble with you, Muncey, you're too finicky.
